intro: Chamaesyce hsinchuensis, commonly known as Hsinchu sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
